challenge.title: Understanding Boolean Values
challenge.description:
Another data type is the Boolean. Booleans may only be one of two values: true or false. They are basically little on-off switches, where true is on and false is off. These two states are mutually exclusive.

Note: Boolean values are never written with quotes. The strings "true" and "false" are not Boolean and have no special meaning in JavaScript.
challenge.instructions: Modify the welcomeToBooleans function so that it returns true instead of false.

tests.text: The welcomeToBooleans() function should return a Boolean (true or false) value.

challengeFiles.name: script
script
